data.title: Human Communication
data.meta_description:
Sinhala Language - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. This document provides an overview of the Sinhala language. Some key points:

- Sinhala is the primary language of Sri Lanka, spoken by about 16 million people as their first language. 

- It is an Indo-Aryan language written in the Sinhala script. Sinhala has been influenced by neighboring Dravidian languages through centuries of contact.

- The document discusses the history and development of Sinhala, from its origins as a Prakrit language to its modern forms, and notes substratum influences from other languages spoken in Sri Lanka like Vedda.
